name: Common Cold
symptoms: Runny nose, sneezing, sore throat, mild fever.

name: Influenza (Flu)
symptoms: High fever, body aches, extreme fatigue, headache, cough.

name: Migraine
symptoms: Severe, throbbing headache, often on one side; sensitivity to light and sound; nausea.
treatment: Triptans, preventative medication, dark, quiet room.

name: Allergies
symptoms: Itchy or watery eyes, sneezing, nasal congestion, hives.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
keywords: memory loss, losing interest, disorientation, poor judgement
symptoms: memory loss, language issues, forgetting things, no interest.
treatment: medical dosage(differs from person to person), cognitive and brain exercises.

name: Epilepsy
keywords: seizures, temporary confusion leading to seizures, random spasms, loss of conciousness
symptoms: psychic symptoms, staring in space, loss of consciousness, abnormal brain activities.
treatment: consult proper doctor, stress management, healthy diet.

name: Coronary Heart Disease (CHD
keywords: pain in chest, breathlessness, palpitations, fatigue, nausea
symptoms: pain in chest, breathlessness, palpitations, nausea, random fatigues.
treatment: control blood pressure, manage cholestrol, do exercises.

name: Parkinson's Disease
keywords: tremor, slow movement, muscle stiffness, shuffling, bad balance, small handwriting
symptoms: A tremor that typically starts in a hand or fingers when at rest (pill-rolling tremor), slowed movement (bradykinesia), rigid muscles, impaired posture and balance, shuffling steps, and smaller handwriting (micrographia).
treatment: Always consult your neurologist. Engage in regular physical activity, maintain a healthy diet, manage stress with techniques like yoga or meditation, and ensure you get adequate sleep.

name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
keywords: fatigue, numbness, tingling, muscle weakness, vision problems, dizziness, cognitive changes
symptoms: Debilitating fatigue, numbness or tingling in limbs, muscle weakness or stiffness (spasticity), vision problems like blurred or double vision, dizziness, and cognitive difficulties with memory or concentration.
treatment: Coordinate with your healthcare provider. Regular exercise, a nutrient-rich diet, stress management, and good sleep hygiene are recommended to manage symptoms.

name: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD)
keywords: leg cramps, leg pain, leg numbness, cold feet, slow healing sores, weak leg pulse
symptoms: Painful muscle cramping in the legs during exercise (claudication), leg numbness or weakness, coldness in one foot compared to the other, slow-healing sores on legs or feet, and a weak pulse in the leg.
treatment: Lifestyle changes including diet and exercise are key. It is important to control blood pressure and manage cholesterol, often with medication.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
keywords: abdominal pain, bloating, gas, diarrhea, constipation, mucus in stool
symptoms: Abdominal pain or cramping, a bloated feeling, gas, and diarrhea or constipation. Some people may have mucus in their stool or feel like a bowel movement is incomplete.
treatment: Stress management through techniques like meditation or yoga is beneficial. Regular exercise, adequate sleep, and avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol can also improve symptoms.

name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
keywords: heartburn, acid reflux, regurgitation, chest pain, chronic cough, sore throat
symptoms: A burning sensation in the chest (heartburn), regurgitation of food or sour liquid, difficulty swallowing, and a chronic cough or sore throat.
treatment: Managing stress is important as the gut and brain are connected. Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night and avoid heavy alcohol consumption and smoking, which can irritate the digestive lining.

name: Cystic Fibrosis (CF)
keywords: salty skin, persistent cough, thick mucus, lung infections, poor growth, greasy stools
symptoms: Very salty-tasting skin, a persistent cough that produces thick mucus, wheezing, frequent lung infections like pneumonia or bronchitis, and poor weight gain despite a good appetite.
treatment: Focus on improving coping strategies and mental health. Connecting with support groups can help you share experiences and feel less isolated. Being an informed patient is also a key part of management.

name: Sickle Cell Disease
keywords: pain crisis, anemia, fatigue, swollen hands, sickle cell, frequent infections
symptoms: Episodes of severe pain (pain crises), anemia leading to fatigue, swelling of hands and feet, frequent infections, and delayed growth.
treatment: Interventions aimed at improving mental health and coping strategies are beneficial. Support networks can provide access to resources and reduce feelings of isolation.

name: Huntington's Disease
keywords: chorea, jerky movements, cognitive decline, depression, difficulty swallowing, slurred speech
symptoms: Involuntary jerky movements (chorea), cognitive decline affecting memory and judgment, psychiatric symptoms like depression and irritability, and muscle problems like rigidity or dystonia.
treatment: Focus on psychological well-being and coping strategies. It is helpful to connect with support networks and advocate for resources and research.
